content:
XhtmlObjectListAdapter Class

In this Article

Provides an object list adapter for the mobile XHTML adapter set. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class XhtmlObjectListAdapter : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ControlAdapter
  • System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter
  • XhtmlObjectListAdapter

Remarks

The XhtmlObjectListAdapter class can be used by mobile control developers to display an ObjectList control on new devices or for new markup standards. For more information, see Control and Adapter Interaction.

Constructors summary

XhtmlObjectListAdapter()

Creates a new instance of the XhtmlObjectListAdapter class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Fields summary

BackToList

A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate whether the user should be returned to the list view. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ShowMore

A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate whether the list should jump to the first item beyond the currently visible items. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ShowMoreFormat

A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate that the browser should jump to a specific item in the list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

Control

Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Methods summary

CreateTemplatedUI(Boolean)

Called by a control to create a templated user interface (UI) if device templates are defined. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
HandlePostBackEvent(String)

Returns true if the event was handled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
HasCommands()

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the ObjectList control contains any commands. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
HasDefaultCommand()

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an ObjectList control contains a default command. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
HasItemDetails()

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a list item can display all fields of an item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnlyHasDefaultCommand()

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an ObjectList control contains a default command and no other commands. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnPreRender(EventArgs)

Called prior to rendering the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Render(XhtmlMobileTextWriter)

Renders the control on the page using the provided XhtmlMobileTextWriter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RenderItemDetails(XhtmlMobileTextWriter,ObjectListItem)

Renders the details of the specified item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
RenderItemsList(XhtmlMobileTextWriter)

Renders the list of items in the ObjectList control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Constructors

  • XhtmlObjectListAdapter()

    Creates a new instance of the XhtmlObjectListAdapter class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public XhtmlObjectListAdapter ();

Fields

  • BackToList

    A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate whether the user should be returned to the list view. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected static readonly string BackToList;

    Remarks

    The BackToList field, which is the value "__back", is used by mobile control developers.

  • ShowMore

    A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate whether the list should jump to the first item beyond the currently visible items. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected static readonly string ShowMore;

    Remarks

    The ShowMore field, which is the value "__more", is used by mobile control developers.

  • ShowMoreFormat

    A string constant used in postback event arguments to indicate that the browser should jump to a specific item in the list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected static readonly string ShowMoreFormat;

    Remarks

    The ShowMoreFormat field, which is an internal field and has the value "__moren", where n is a number, is created during rendering. This field is used like the ShowMore field, except that it specifies the index of the item to display in details view.

    The ShowMoreFormat field is used by mobile control developers.

Properties

  • Control

    Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList Control { get; }

    Property Value

    • ObjectList

      An ObjectList.

Methods

  • CreateTemplatedUI(Boolean)

    Called by a control to create a templated user interface (UI) if device templates are defined. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override void CreateTemplatedUI (bool doDataBind);

    Parameters

    • doDataBind
      Boolean

      true to bind the templated UI to the underlying ObjectList; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default implementation of the CreateTemplatedUI method calls the CreateTemplatedUI method of the corresponding control adapter, which in turn can either call back the CreateTemplatedItemsList method or the CreateTemplatedItemDetails method for the control, or create its own device-specific templated UI.

  • HandlePostBackEvent(String)

    Returns true if the event was handled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override bool HandlePostBackEvent (string eventArgument);

    Parameters

    • eventArgument
      String

      Name of the event.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the event was handled; otherwise false.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      the postback data is invalid.

    Remarks

    This method is called by a control when it receives a postback event notification, to check whether the event is adapter-specific. If the control implements the IPostBackEventHandler method and receives a postback event, the RaisePostBackEvent method of the control adapter is called. If events sent to the control can vary depending on the target device, the control implementation of this method must call the HandlePostBackEvent method of the control adapter.

    This method returns true or false, indicating whether the device adapter handled the event. It returns false by default.

  • HasCommands()

    Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the ObjectList control contains any commands. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected bool HasCommands ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the associated ObjectList has one or more commands; otherwise, false.

  • HasDefaultCommand()

    Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an ObjectList control contains a default command. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected bool HasDefaultCommand ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if an ObjectList contains a default command; otherwise, false.

  • HasItemDetails()

    Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a list item can display all fields of an item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual bool HasItemDetails ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if all fields of a list item can be displayed; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The value of the HasItemDetails method indicates that the item needs a details view in order for the user to see all the data.

  • OnlyHasDefaultCommand()

    Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an ObjectList control contains a default command and no other commands. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected bool OnlyHasDefaultCommand ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if an ObjectList has a default command and no other commands; otherwise, false.

  • OnPreRender(EventArgs)

    Called prior to rendering the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override void OnPreRender (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An object (defined by EventArgs) that contains event data.

  • Render(XhtmlMobileTextWriter)

    Renders the control on the page using the provided XhtmlMobileTextWriter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override void Render (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XhtmlMobileTextWriter

      The XhtmlMobileTextWriter used to render the server control content on the client's browser.

  • RenderItemDetails(XhtmlMobileTextWriter,ObjectListItem)

    Renders the details of the specified item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void RenderItemDetails (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem item);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XhtmlMobileTextWriter

      An XhtmlMobileTextWriter.

    • item
      ObjectListItem

      An ObjectListItem.

    Remarks

    The RenderItemDetails method is called during rendering for the details view of the specific item in the ObjectList control.

  • RenderItemsList(XhtmlMobileTextWriter)

    Renders the list of items in the ObjectList control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void RenderItemsList (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XhtmlMobileTextWriter

      An XhtmlMobileTextWriter.

    Remarks

    The RenderItemsList method is called during rendering to render each item in the list.
